PC Japanese (JP): ワルギリアはベアトと違い、礼儀正しく、義理を重んじた為、天界や魔界など、様々な異界に大勢の友人を持つらしい。
Russian (RU): В отличие от Беато, {f:5:Вергилия} всегда вела себя правильно и вежливо, поэтому у неё было много друзей в других мирах, в том числе на небе и в мире демонов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Diferente da Beato, parece que a {f:5:Virgilia} sempre agiu de forma educada e cortês, por isso ela tem tantos amigos de outros mundos, incluindo o Reino do Céu e o Mundo dos Demônios.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 瓦爾基莉亞與貝阿朵不同，彬彬有禮、重情重義，所以她好像在天界魔界等種種異界，有著許許多多的友人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 瓦尔基莉亚与贝阿朵不同，彬彬有礼、重情重义，所以她好像在天界魔界等种种异界，有着许许多多的友人。

Umineko Project (UP): Surprisingly, Dlanor was one of them......
Steam (ST): Surprisingly, Dlanor was one of them......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Surprisingly, Dlanor was one of them......
PC Japanese (JP): ドラノールも、その内のひとりだとは驚きだ……。
Russian (RU): Удивительно, что среди них была Дланор......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Inesperadamente, Dlanor era um desses amigos......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過驚人的是，德拉諾爾居然也是其中之一……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过惊人的是，德拉诺尔居然也是其中之一……。

Umineko Project (UP): Dlanor, who had crossed swords with "me" just a short while ago, bowed her head as if to thank us for allowing her shelter from the sudden rain, and sat in the seat {f:5:Virgilia} pointed out, like a guest.
Steam (ST): Dlanor, who had crossed swords with "me" just a short while ago, ducked her head like someone taking shelter from a sudden rain and sat in the seat {f:5:Virgilia} pointed out, like a guest.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Dlanor, who had crossed swords with 'me' just a short while ago, ducked her head as though taking shelter from a sudden rain, and sat in the seat Virgilia pointed out, like a guest.
PC Japanese (JP): ついさっきまで、“俺”と太刀を交えていたドラノールは、まるで急な雨に軒を借りるかのように頭を下げ、ワルギリアが勧めた席に、客人のように座った。
Russian (RU): Дланор, совсем недавно скрестившая со 'мной' мечи, склонила голову, словно укрываясь от внезапного дождя, и, как гостья, села на стул, на который указала {f:5:Вергилия}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dlanor, que cruzou espadas "comigo" há pouco tempo atrás, baixou a cabeça como se estivesse nos agradecendo por permitir que ela se abrigasse da chuva, e se sentou no assento que a {f:5:Virgilia} apontou, como se fosse uma convidada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就在剛才，還在與“我”刀來劍往地交戰的德拉諾爾，宛如因突如其來的雨而躲進屋檐般，低下頭像個客人一樣地，坐到了瓦爾基莉亞所指的椅子上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就在刚才，还在与“我”刀来剑往地交战的德拉诺尔，宛如因突如其来的雨而躲进屋檐般，低下头像个客人一样地，坐到了瓦尔基莉亚所指的椅子上。

Umineko Project (UP): "Magic that hides the result in darkness is {f:5:evil}. We will not permit {f:5:it}. However, magic that conceals the process is not necessarily {f:5:evil}. My foe is the evil, not the magic {f:5:itself}."

PC Japanese (JP): 「……ベアト。俺はあいつから、………何を知れというんだ……？　それがお前の心臓を探し出し、……安らかに眠らせることと、関係があるのか……？」
Russian (RU): "......Беато. Что я......... должен был узнать от неё?.. Это как‐то связано с тем, чтобы постичь твоё сердце...... и дать тебе обрести покой?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Beato. O que eu.........deveria aprender com ela......? Isso tem algo a ver com encontrar o seu coração......e deixá‐la descansar em paz......?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……貝阿朵。你希望我從那傢伙身上，………明白些什麼……？這與找出你的心臟，……使你安寧睡去，有關係嗎……？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……贝阿朵。你希望我从那家伙身上，………明白些什么……？这与找出你的心脏，……使你安宁睡去，有关系吗……？」

Umineko Project (UP): The natural enemy of witches. Inquisitor.{n}......A vanguard of mystery...who denies fantasy.
Steam (ST): The natural enemy of witches. An Inquisitor of Heresy. ...A vanguard of mystery...who denies fantasy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The natural enemy of witches. Inquisitor of Heresy.......A vanguard of mystery...who denies fantasy.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女の天敵。異端審問官。……ファンタジーを否定する、ミステリーの尖兵。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 魔女の天敵。異端審問官。{n}……ファンタジーを否定する、ミステリーの尖兵。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O inimigo natural das bruxas. Uma Inquisidora.{n}......A vanguarda do mistério...aqueles que negam a fantasia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女的天敵。異端審問官。{n}……否定幻想劇的，推理劇的尖兵。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女的天敌。异端审问官。{n}……否定幻想剧的，推理剧的尖兵。

Steam (ST): Is she here to help... ...by gouging out your heart... ...and choking the life out of you......?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Is she here to help......by gouging out your heart......and choking the life out of you.........?

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): お前の心臓を抉り出し、……息の根を止めるための、……手助けだとでも言うのか………？
Russian (RU): Она здесь, чтобы помочь...... пронзая твоё сердце...... и выбивая из тебя жизнь?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela veio aqui para me ajudar......goivar seu coração......e cessar sua respiração.........?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 難道她是算，……幫助掏出你心臟，……令你斷氣的外援嗎………？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 难道她是算，……帮助掏出你心脏，……令你断气的外援吗………？

Russian (RU): [=OG]
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Traditional (CHT): [=JPC]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=JPC]

Umineko Project (UP): Cornelia slowly got up and stood on one leg, as she had been ordered.
Steam (ST): Cornelia slowly got up and stood on one leg, as she had been ordered.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Cornelia slowly got up, and, as she had been ordered, stood on one leg.
PC Japanese (JP): コーネリアはゆっくりと立ち上がり、命じられるままに、片足で立つ。
Russian (RU): Корнелия медленно поднялась и, как ей было приказано, встала на одну ногу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Cornelia lentamente levantou e ficou de pé com apenas uma perna, assim como foi ordenado a ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 柯內莉亞緩緩站了起來，遵照命令以單腳站立。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 柯内莉亚缓缓站了起来，遵照命令以单脚站立。

Umineko Project (UP): Her hands were clasped behind her back. ...Because she had been ordered to do so.
Steam (ST): Her hands were clasped behind her back. ...Because she had been ordered to do so.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Her hands were clasped behind her back....Because she had been ordered to do so.
PC Japanese (JP): 両手は後で組んでいる。そう命じられているからだ。
Russian (RU): Её руки были сложены за спиной. ...Потому что ей приказали так сделать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Suas mãos estavam juntas atrás de suas costas. ...Porque assim ela foi ordenada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她的雙手交叉著放在了身後。而這也是繪梨花的命令。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她的双手交叉着放在了身后。而这也是绘梨花的命令。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, with a loud thump, Erika shoved her from behind with both hands.
Steam (ST): Then, with a *thump*, Erika pushed her from behind with both hands.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, with a *thump*, Erika pushed her from behind with both hands.
PC Japanese (JP): それを、ドン、っと。ヱリカは後から両手で突き飛ばす。
Russian (RU): *удар*. Эрика обеими руками толкнула её сзади.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, com um grande baam, Erika a empurrou por trás com ambas as mãos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，“啪”的一聲。繪梨花從其身後，以雙手猛地一推。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，“啪”的一声。绘梨花从其身后，以双手猛地一推。

Umineko Project (UP): Cornelia landed on the floor face first with a thud.
Steam (ST): Cornelia landed on the floor face first with a *thud*.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Cornelia landed on the floor face first with a *thud*.
PC Japanese (JP): コーネリアはばたんと床に、顔面から倒れた。
Russian (RU): Корнелия с глухим стуком ударилась лицом об пол.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Cornelia caiu ao chão, batendo primeiramente com seu rosto contra o piso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): “啪嘡”，柯內莉亞臉先著地地摔到了地板上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): “啪嘡”，柯内莉亚脸先着地地摔到了地板上。

Umineko Project (UP): Cornelia rose shakily.{n}Then, once again, she stood on one leg as she had been ordered.
Steam (ST): Cornelia rose shakily. Then, once again, she stood on one leg as she had been ordered.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Cornelia rose shakily. Then, once again, she stood on one leg as she had been ordered.
PC Japanese (JP): コーネリアはよろよろと立ち上がる。そして再び、命じられるままに片足で立つ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): コーネリアはよろよろと立ち上がる。{n}そして再び、命じられるままに片足で立つ。
Russian (RU): Корнелия неуверенно поднялась.{n}И снова встала на одну ногу, как ей приказали.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Cornelia se levantou, trêmula.{n}Então, mais uma vez, ela permaneceu de pé com uma única perna, assim como foi ordenado a ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 柯內莉亞搖搖晃晃地站了起來。{n}然後再次遵照命令，以單腳站立。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 柯内莉亚摇摇晃晃地站了起来。{n}然后再次遵照命令，以单脚站立。

Umineko Project (UP): She had been ordered not to try to keep her balance.{n}So she had fallen on her face over and over again.
Steam (ST): She had been ordered not to hold her ground. So she had fallen on her face over and over again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had been ordered not to hold her ground. So she had fallen on her face over and over again.
PC Japanese (JP): 踏み止まるなと命じられている。だから、顔面から何度も転ばされる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 踏み止まるなと命じられている。{n}だから、顔面から何度も転ばされる。
Russian (RU): Ей было велено не смягчать падение.{n}Поэтому она снова и снова падала на лицо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não recebeu ordens para tentar manter o equilíbrio.{n}Por isso continuou a cair com o rosto no chão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她被命令過，不准放下另一只腳來防止跌倒。{n}所以，臉先著地，一次又一次地被推倒在地。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她被命令过，不准放下另一只脚来防止跌倒。{n}所以，脸先着地，一次又一次地被推倒在地。

Umineko Project (UP): She had barely managed to protect her nose, but after smashing against the floor so many times, her face was bright red.
Steam (ST): She had barely managed to protect her nose, but after smashing against the floor so many times, her face was bright red.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had barely managed to protect her nose, but after smashing against the floor so many times, her face was bright red.
PC Japanese (JP): 辛うじて鼻筋だけは守っているが、何度も床に叩き付けられ、顔は真っ赤だった。
Russian (RU): Ей едва удалось защитить нос, но после стольких ударов об пол её лицо стало ярко‐красным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela mal conseguiu proteger seu nariz, e depois de cair de cara contra o chão tantas vezes, seu rosto ficou em vermelho‐vivo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然勉強保住了鼻梁，但由於接連撞蹭地板，臉變得紅通通的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然勉强保住了鼻梁，但由于接连撞蹭地板，脸变得红通通的。

Steam (ST): She wasn't shedding any tears. No, she couldn't shed them. Because she was forbidden to do even that...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She wasn't shedding any tears. No, she couldn't shed them. Because she was forbidden to do even that......

Russian (RU): Она не проливала слёзы. Нет, скорее, не могла.{n}Потому что даже это ей было запрещено...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não derramou uma lágrima sequer. Não, ela não podia derramar.{n}Porque ela foi proibida de fazer isso......

Chinese Simplified (CN): 没有流泪。错、是不让流泪。{n}就连落泪，都遭到了绘梨花的禁止……。

Umineko Project (UP): Erika repeated this falling torture over and over again.
Steam (ST): Erika repeated this falling torture over and over again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Erika repeated this falling torture over and over again.
PC Japanese (JP): その転倒の拷問を、ヱリカは何度も何度も繰り返している。
Russian (RU): Эрика раз за разом повторяла пытку с падением.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Erika repetiu esta tortura de queda incontáveis vezes.

Umineko Project (UP): At times like this, Erika hated counting things.
Steam (ST): At times like this, Erika hated counting things.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At times like this, Erika hated counting things.
PC Japanese (JP): こういう時のヱリカは、物を数えるのが大嫌いだった。
Russian (RU): В таких случаях она ненавидела считать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em momentos assim, Erika odiava contar as coisas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這種時候的繪梨花，最討厭數數了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这种时候的绘梨花，最讨厌数数了。

Umineko Project (UP): So she decided that, when she ran out of fingers to keep count on, she would just keep on going until she lost interest.
Steam (ST): So she decided that, once she ran out of fingers to count the number of times, she would just repeat it until she lost interest.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So she decided that, once she ran out of fingers to count the number of times, she would just repeat it until she lost interest.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、両手の指で足らなくなったら、飽きるまで繰り返せばいいと決めている。
Russian (RU): И поэтому решила, что как только пальцы для счёта закончатся, она просто будет повторять, пока не надоест.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso ela decidiu que, quando não tivesse mais dedos para contar, ela ainda continuaria até perder o interesse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，一旦雙手手指不夠用了，她就會一直重複到膩了為止。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，一旦双手手指不够用了，她就会一直重复到腻了为止。

Umineko Project (UP): However, Erika's main redeeming feature was that she never lost interest in anything, so the torture continued on without end......
Steam (ST): However, Erika's main redeeming feature was that she never lost interest in anything, so the torture continued on and on...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, Erika's main redeeming feature was that she never lost interest in anything, so the torture continued on without end......
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、ヱリカの取り得は飽きないことだったので、その拷問はいつまでも終わらないのだ……。
Russian (RU): Но её главным достоинством было как раз то, что она никогда ни к чему не теряла интерес, поэтому пытка продолжалась без конца......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, a principal característica dela era de nunca perder o interesse em nada, por isso a tortura continuaria para sempre......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，不會膩乃是繪梨花的特長，所以，這個拷問沒完沒了沒有結束……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，不会腻乃是绘梨花的特长，所以，这个拷问没完没了没有结束……。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Erika didn't know the truth...of why Cornelia had been unable to fully protect the window.
Steam (ST): ...Erika didn't know why Cornelia had been unable to fully protect the window.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Erika didn't know why Cornelia had been unable to fully protect the window.
PC Japanese (JP): ……ヱリカは、なぜコーネリアが窓を守りきれなかったか、…その事情を知らない。
Russian (RU): ......Эрика не знала, почему Корнелия не смогла защитить окно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Erika não sabia a verdade...sobre o motivo pelo qual Cornelia foi incapaz de proteger por completo a janela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……關於為什麼柯內莉亞沒能守住窗戶，…繪梨花不知其中內情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……关于为什么柯内莉亚没能守住窗户，…绘梨花不知其中内情。

Umineko Project (UP): So the whole time since then, ......she had been criticizing her, blaming her entirely for their defeat.
Steam (ST): So the whole time since then, ...she had placed all the blame of their loss on her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So the whole time since then, ......she had placed all the blame of their loss on her.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、敗北の責任は全て彼女のせいだと、……さっきからずっと責めているのだ。
Russian (RU): Поэтому с того момента...... возложила всю вину за их поражение на неё.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, durante todo o tempo desde então, ......Erika a criticou, a culpou inteiramente pela derrota.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，繪梨花認為，敗北的責任全在柯內莉亞的身上，……從剛才起一直在責備著她。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，绘梨花认为，败北的责任全在柯内莉亚的身上，……从刚才起一直在责备着她。

Speaker: Gertrude
Umineko Project (UP): "......For your attention: I beg to state the following. Please forgive Cornelia for her failing. She has already performed sufficient penance..."
Steam (ST): "...Please, allow me to speak. Forgive Cornelia. She has already repented enough..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Please, allow me to speak. Forgive Cornelia. She has already done enough in repentance..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……謹啓、謹んで申し上げまする。コーネリアの咎を許し給え。すでに彼女の咎の禊ぎには充分なりや…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……謹啓、謹んで申し上げ奉る。コーネリアの咎を許し給え。すでに彼女の咎の禊ぎには充分なりや…」
Russian (RU): "......Уважаемые присутствующие, я смиренно прошу слова. Простите Корнелию. Она уже более чем искупила свою вину..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Senhoris, permitam‐me ratificar. Por favor, peço que perdoe Cornelia por sua falha. Ela já performou penalidade suficiente..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……謹啟，容稟。請寬恕柯內莉亞的罪過。她的罪過，已受了足夠的洗禮…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……谨启，容禀。请宽恕柯内莉亚的罪过。她的罪过，已受了足够的洗礼…」

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "Oh, is that so? Then please take her place from now on."
Steam (ST): "Oh, is that true? Then please take her place from now on."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Oh, is that true? Then please take her place from now on."
PC Japanese (JP): 「あぁ、そうですか？　ではここからはあなたが代わって下さい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あぁ、そうですか？　ではここからはあなたが代わって下さい」
Russian (RU): "О, правда? Тогда попрошу тебя занять её место."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ora, é mesmo? Então vou pedir que assuma o lugar dela agora."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊啊、是嗎？那麼，接下來請由你來替代她。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊啊、是吗？那么，接下来请由你来替代她。」

Speaker: Cornelia
Umineko Project (UP): "G‐......Gertrude bears no sin for which to repent......"
Steam (ST): "...G-Gertrude has done nothing wrong..."

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "{p:2:Just as an example, let's say it was deliberately stuck to the underside of...the serving cart carrying the tea set, which the servants wheeled into the room. It was simply affixed there in a way that would make it come unstuck after a certain amount of time, such that when it eventually fell off, it would become "the letter left by a witch who shouldn't exist". In other words, this is a classic trick where the true sender gives themselves an alibi by making the letter appear at a different time}."
Steam (ST): "{p:2:Just as an example, let's say it was deliberately stuck to the underside of... the serving cart carrying the tea set, which the servants wheeled into the room. It was simply affixed there in a way that would make it come unstuck after a certain amount of time, such that when it eventually fell off, it would become "the letter left by a witch who shouldn't exist". In other words, this is a classic trick where the true sender gives themselves an alibi by making the letter appear at a different time}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "{p:2:Just as an example, let's say it was stuck to the bottom of the serving cart the servants were pushing. It was simply glued there in a way that would make it come unstuck after a certain amount of time. When it eventually fell off, it became 'the letter left behind by a witch' who shouldn't have existed. In other words, this is a classic trick where the true sender gives themselves an alibi by making the letter appear at a different time.}"
PC Japanese (JP): 「{p:2:仮の想像ですが、例えば、使用人たちが押してきた、お茶の道具を積んだ配膳車の下部の裏側に貼り付けられていたとか。それは時間が経てば剥がれてしまうような、簡単な接着。それはやがて剥がれ落ちて、存在しないはずの“魔女が置いて行った手紙”となる。つまり、時間差で手紙が現れるようにすることで、真の差出人がその時刻にアリバイを作ろうとする、古典的トリックです。}」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「{p:2:仮の想像ですが、例えば、使用人たちが押してきた、お茶の道具を積んだ配膳車の下部の裏側に貼り付けられていたとか。それは時間が経てば剥がれてしまうような、簡単な接着。それはやがて剥がれ落ちて、存在しないはずの“魔女が置いて行った手紙”となる。つまり、時間差で手紙が現れるようにすることで、真の差出人がその時刻にアリバイを作ろうとする、古典的トリックです}」
Russian (RU): "{p:2:К примеру, предположим, оно прилипло к основанию сервировочной тележки, которую везли слуги. Просто было приклеено так, чтобы через определённое время отклеиться. В конце концов упав, оно стало 'письмом, оставленным ведьмой', которой не должно быть. В общем, это классический трюк, когда настоящий отправитель отсрочивает появление письма, чтобы сделать себе алиби}."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "{p:2:Um simples exemplo, vamos dizer que ela deliberadamente foi presa debaixo...do carrinho de serviço que trazia o chá, na qual os serviçais empurraram até a sala. Estava simplesmente presa nele de forma que acabaria caindo depois de um certo tempo e, eventualmente, caiu, fazendo com que "a carta deixada por uma bruxa não exista". Em outras palavras, esse é um clássico truque onde o verdadeiro remetente cria para si um álibi para fazer a carta aparecer em um momento diferente}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「{p:2:假設一下，比如說，在傭人們推進來的，放著茶具的餐車下方的裏側貼著信。那是一種經過一段時間就會掉下來的，簡單的粘貼。它遲早會掉下來，化為原本不存在的“魔女放下的信”。也就是，使信經過時間差出現，為真正的發信人製造那時的不在場證明的古典詭計。}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「{p:2:假设一下，比如说，在佣人们推进来的，放着茶具的餐车下方的里侧贴着信。那是一种经过一段时间就会掉下来的，简单的粘贴。它迟早会掉下来，化为原本不存在的“魔女放下的信”。也就是，使信经过时间差出现，为真正的发信人制造那时的不在场证明的古典诡计。}」

Umineko Project (UP): {e:070:A direct knock refers to someone literally hitting a door to make a knocking sound.{n}An intentional knock refers to someone creating a fake knocking sound with intent to make it appear that someone knocked.{n}An unintentional knock refers to someone unintentionally creating a fake knocking sound.{n}A coincidental knock refers to some kind of coincidence creating a fake knocking sound.}
Steam (ST): {e:070:A direct knock refers to someone literally hitting a door to make a knocking sound. {n}An intentional knock refers to someone creating a fake knocking sound with intent to make it appear that someone knocked. {n}An unintentional knock refers to someone unintentionally creating a fake knocking sound. {n}A coincidental knock refers to some kind of coincidence creating a fake knocking sound.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A direct knock refers to someone literally hitting a door to make a knocking sound. An intentional knock refers to someone creating a fake knocking sound to try and make it appear that someone knocked. An unintentional knock refers to someone unintentionally creating a fake knocking sound. A coincidental knock refers to some kind of coincidence creating a fake knocking sound.
PC Japanese (JP): {e:070:直接的ノックとは、文字通り、誰かが扉を叩いてノック音をさせたこと。{n}意図的ノックとは、誰かがノックを装い、擬似ノック音を発生させたこと。{n}無意識的ノックとは、誰かが無意識に意図せず、擬似ノック音を発生させたこと。{n}偶発的ノックとは、何かの偶然によって、擬似ノック音が発生してしまったこと。}
Russian (RU): {e:070:Прямой стук — кто‐то буквально ударил по двери, чтобы вызвать звук стука.{n}Умышленный — кто‐то сымитировал стук, пытаясь сделать вид, что в дверь постучали.{n}Неумышленный — кто‐то ненамеренно вызвал фальшивый звук стука.{n}Случайный — фальшивый стук был вызван неким совпадением}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {e:070:Uma batida direta refere‐se a alguém literalmente batendo na porta e criando um som de batida.{n}Uma batida intencional refere‐se a alguém criando um falso som de batida com a intenção de fazer parecer que alguém bateu na porta.{n}Uma batida não intencional refere‐se a alguém criando o som de uma batida de forma não intencional.{n}Uma batida coincidente refere‐se a algum tipo de batida coincidente que gerou o som de uma falsa batida.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {e:070:直接的敲門，與字面意思一樣，是指某人敲門，發出了敲門聲。{n}有意的敲門，是指某人有意創造敲門的假象，搞出了疑似敲門的聲音。{n}無意識的敲門，是指某人無意識、無意圖地搞出了疑似敲門的聲音。{n}偶發的敲門，是指因某一偶然，而搞出了疑似敲門的聲音。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {e:070:直接的敲门，与字面意思一样，是指某人敲门，发出了敲门声。{n}有意的敲门，是指某人有意创造敲门的假象，搞出了疑似敲门的声音。{n}无意识的敲门，是指某人无意识、无意图地搞出了疑似敲门的声音。{n}偶发的敲门，是指因某一偶然，而搞出了疑似敲门的声音。}

Umineko Project (UP): Therefore, this literally meant...that "it was impossible for anyone inside the mansion to knock", with no wordplay allowed.

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "Like me, for example. {p:2:What if I, Furudo Erika, recorded a knocking sound on a cassette tape, secretly installed it somewhere, and set it up so that it would start playing at exactly midnight? Of course, I wasn't in the mansion at midnight.} There aren't any problems with this, are there?"
Steam (ST): Like me, for example. {p:2:What if I, Furudo Erika, recorded a knocking sound on a cassette tape, secretly installed it somewhere, and set it up so that it would start playing at exactly midnight? Of course, I wasn't in the mansion at midnight.} There aren't any problems with this, are there?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Like me, for example. {p:2:What if I, Furudo Erika, recorded a knocking sound on a cassette tape and used some kind of secret contraption to start it playing at exactly 24:00? Of course, I wasn't in the mansion at 24:00.} There aren't any problems with this, are there?"
PC Japanese (JP): 例えば、私。{p:2:この古戸ヱリカが、カセットテープにノック音を録音し、それをどこかにこっそり仕掛け、ちょうど２４時頃に再生されるような仕掛けを施したなら？　もちろん、２４時の時点では屋敷にはいないわけです。}　これなら何も問題ないじゃないですか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「例えば、私。{p:2:この古戸ヱリカが、カセットテープにノック音を録音し、それをどこかにこっそり仕掛け、ちょうど２４時頃に再生されるような仕掛けを施したなら？　もちろん、２４時の時点では屋敷にはいないわけです。}これなら何も問題ないじゃないですか」
Russian (RU): "Я, например. {p:2:Что если я, Фурудо Эрика, записала стук на кассету и с помощью какого‐нибудь хитроумного изобретения проиграла её ровно в полночь? Разумеется, тогда меня не было в особняке}. И никаких проблем, верно?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Como eu, por exemplo. {p:2:E se eu, Furudo Erika, gravei o som de uma batida em uma fita cassete, escondi ela em algum lugar, e programei para que começasse a tocar exatamente à meia‐noite? É claro, eu não estava na mansão à meia‐noite.} Não tem nenhum problema nisso, tem?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「比如说，我。{p:2:我古户绘梨花，将敲门声录到磁带里，然后偷偷放到某处，设置好了在正好到 24 点时播放，又如何？当然，在 24 点整时，我并不在大屋。}这样，是不是就没有任何问题了呀？」

Speaker: Dlanor
Umineko Project (UP): "There are no {f:5:problems}. However, the knock serves to alert everyone to the existence of the letter, and does so precisely because the letter is on the other side of the {f:5:door}. If the letter had fallen in the kitchen, for instance, I do not think that the knock would have served to inform anyone of the letter's {f:5:existence}."
Steam (ST): "No {f:5:problems}. However, though the knock did serve as a way of informing them about the letter on the other side of the door, I do not think it would have worked if the letter had fallen {f:5:elsewhere}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No PROBLEMS. However, though the knock did serve as a way of informing them about the letter on the other side of the door, I do not think it would have worked if the letter had fallen ELSEWHERE."
PC Japanese (JP): 「問題ないデス。しかし、扉の前に手紙があればこそ、ノックが、その存在を教えるきっかけとなりますが、もし、厨房などに手紙が落下していたら、ノックは手紙の存在を教えるものにはならなかったように思いマス。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「問題ないデス。しかし、扉の前に手紙があればこそ、ノックが、その存在を教えるきっかけとなりますが、もし、厨房などに手紙が落下していたら、ノックは手紙の存在を教えるものにはならなかったように思いマス」
Russian (RU): "Никаких. И всё же, хоть стук и послужил способом сообщить о письме по другую сторону двери, я не думаю, что это сработало бы, упади письмо в другом месте."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não há nenhum {f:5:problema}. Porém, a batida serve para alertar a todos da existência de uma carta, e faz isso precisamente porque a carta está do outro lado da {f:5:porta}. Se a carta tivesse caído na cozinha, por exemplo, eu não acredito que a batida serviria para informar alguém sobre a existência da {f:5:carta}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「沒有問題。只不過我覺得，正因為門前有信，敲門才會成為告知信的存在的提示，如果信掉在廚房等地方的話，敲門聲就不能告知信的存在了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「没有问题。只不过我觉得，正因为门前有信，敲门才会成为告知信的存在的提示，如果信掉在厨房等地方的话，敲门声就不能告知信的存在了。」

Umineko Project (UP): If the trick in Erika's theory about the letter being stuck to the serving cart was accurate, then the location that the letter fell was a matter of luck.
Steam (ST): If the trick in Erika's theory about the letter being stuck to the serving cart was accurate, then the location that the letter fell was a matter of luck.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカの推理したトリック、配膳車の下部貼り付けによるならば、手紙の落下する場所は運任せだ。
Russian (RU): Если хитрость в теории Эрики о письме, прилипшем к сервировочной тележке, была точна, тогда место падения письма зависело от удачи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se o truque de Erika sobre a carta estar presa no carrinho de serviço estiver correto, então o ponto em que a carta caiu foi uma questão de sorte.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 依繪梨花所推理出來的詭計，將信貼到餐車的下方的話，那信掉哪兒就完全是碰運氣了。

Umineko Project (UP): The people in the dining hall were able to notice it due to the knock only because it had fortunately fallen near the door.
Steam (ST): Because it had fortunately fallen near the door, the people in the dining hall noticed it due to the knock.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because it had fortunately fallen near the door, the people in the dining hall noticed it due to the knock.
PC Japanese (JP): うまいこと扉の前に落ちてくれたから、ノックにより、食堂の彼らは手紙の存在に気付けた。
Russian (RU): Поскольку оно, к счастью, упало возле двери, люди в столовой благодаря стуку заметили его.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As pessoas na sala de jantar foram capazes de percebê‐la devido a batida unicamente porque ela teve a sorte de cair perto da porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而它由於正巧掉到了門前，所以因敲門聲，而令身在餐廳的他們發現了信的存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而它由于正巧掉到了门前，所以因敲门声，而令身在餐厅的他们发现了信的存在。

Umineko Project (UP): However, if the location it fell was a matter of chance, ......it might have landed in the far‐off kitchen, ...or even remained stuck the entire time.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, if the location it fell was a matter of chance, ......it might have landed in the far off kitchen or remained stuck even after they entered.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, se o local em que caiu fosse uma questão de sorte, ......poderia ter caído ainda na cozinha, ...ou até mesmo ter ficado presa o tempo todo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 既然信掉到哪兒完全是看運氣，……那就有可能掉在遠離餐廳的廚房，…搞不好甚至還有可能不掉下來，一直粘在下面。

Umineko Project (UP): If that had happened, the knock would have been ignored as though they'd just imagined it.
Steam (ST): If that had happened, the knock would have been ignored as though they'd just imagined it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If that had happened, the knock would have been ignored as though they'd just imagined it.

Russian (RU): Так стук проигнорировали бы, посчитав, что им показалось.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): It only made it appear as though someone had been there because it was paired with the letter.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 通过与信结合在一起，才能首次得以主张，曾有某人来过。

Umineko Project (UP): In that case, the knock can't be combined with the theory of the letter falling from the bottom of a serving cart at a random location.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that case, the random location the letter fell to off the bottom of the serving cart couldn't be connected with the knock.

Umineko Project (UP): "......For example, let's assume there was a device on the serving cart that drops the letter when it stops moving. Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......For example, let's assume there was a device on the serving cart that 'drops the letter when it stops moving'. PC Japanese (JP): 「……例えば、配膳車に“停車すると手紙が落ちる”という仕掛けがあったと仮定する。これならば、食堂の扉でノックするために、一度停車するだろうことが事前に予見できるから、うまいこと扉の前に手紙を落とせるように思えるかもしれない。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……例えば、配膳車に“停車すると手紙が落ちる”という仕掛けがあったと仮定する。これならば、食堂の扉でノックするために、一度停車するだろうことが事前に予見できるから、うまいこと扉の前に手紙を落とせるように思えるかもしれない」

O culpado poderia prever que o carrinho pararia quando os dois batessem na porta da sala de jantar, e com essa teoria você poderia pensar que você habilmente fez a carta cair no lugar certo, em frente à porta."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……比如說，假定餐車上有“車一停就掉下信”的機關。用這機關的話，因為能事前預料到，為了敲餐廳的門，餐車將於那時暫且停下，所以大家也許會以為，能夠巧妙地令信掉在門前。」

Speaker: {f:5:Lambdadelta}
Umineko Project (UP): "{p:1:Misidentifying a knocking sound means this: they would not mistake a sound very similar to a knocking sound for a real knocking sound. Hitting a pillar to make something similar to a knocking sound is no good. When you record a knocking sound on a cassette tape and play it back, it becomes "the sound of a tape with a knocking sound on it", and not a knocking sound. So that's no good either}!"
Steam (ST): "{p:1:Misidentifying a knocking sound means this: they would not mistake a sound very similar to a knocking sound for a real knocking sound. Hitting a pillar to make something similar to a knocking sound is no good. When you record a knocking sound on a cassette tape and play it back, it becomes "the sound of a tape with a knocking sound on it", and not a knocking sound. So that's no good either}!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "{p:1:Misidentifying a knocking sound means this: they would not mistake a sound very similar to a knocking sound for a real knocking sound. Hitting a pillar to make something similar to a knocking sound is no good. When you record a knocking sound on a cassette tape and play it back, it becomes 'the sound of the tape with a knocking sound on it', and not a knocking sound. So that's no good either!}"
PC Japanese (JP): 「{p:1:ノック音を誤認しない、ということはつまり。ノック音によく似た他の音を、ノック音と勘違いしたりはしない、ということよ。柱を叩くとノックに似た音がする、なんてのもアウト。ノック音をカセットテープに録音したとしても、それはもはや“ノック音を録音したテープの音”であって、ノック音ではない。だからこれもアウト！}」
Russian (RU): "{p:1:'Правильно распознали' означает вот что: они не приняли звук, очень похожий на стук, за настоящий стук. Удар по столбу для имитации чего‐то похожего на стук не годится. При записи стука на кассету и его воспроизведении он становится 'звуком ленты со стуком', а не самим стуком. Так что и это никуда не годится}!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "{p:1:Confundir o som de uma batida significa: elas não iriam cometer o equívoco de achar que um som muito similar a uma batida na porta era uma batida de verdade na porta. Bater em uma coluna para reproduzir um som similar não serve. Quando você grava o som de uma batida em uma fita cassete, ele se torna "o som de uma fita com uma batida gravada nela", e não o som de uma batida na porta. Por isso também não serve}!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「{p:1:所謂“不會聽錯敲門聲”。就是指，不會將非常像敲門聲的別的聲音，誤聽為敲門聲喲。像敲柱子發出類似敲門聲什麼的，也出局哦。而將敲門聲錄到磁帶裡，這個也歸根結底是“錄下了敲門聲的磁帶的聲音”，並非敲門聲。所以這個也出局！}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「{p:1:所谓“不会听错敲门声”。就是指，不会将非常像敲门声的别的声音，误听为敲门声哟。像敲柱子发出类似敲门声什么的，也出局哦。而将敲门声录到磁带里，这个也归根结底是“录下了敲门声的磁带的声音”，并非敲门声。所以这个也出局！}」

Steam (ST): "{p:1:In other words, all of them would correctly distinguish a knocking sound of something truly hitting the door, and they definitely wouldn't mishear it. It's totally impossible that any sounds except hitting that door directly would be misinterpreted as a knock}!!"

PC Japanese (JP): そこに、ヱリカの入り込む余地はない。
Russian (RU): Здесь для Эрики не было места.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não havia mais espaço para Erika.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此中沒有繪梨花加入的餘地。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此中没有绘梨花加入的余地。

Umineko Project (UP): If she resigned herself to that, ......she would literally have no place to go, ......and would be buried in an eternal oblivion.
Steam (ST): If she contented herself with that, ...she would literally have no place to go... ...and would be buried in an eternal oblivion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If she contented herself with that, ......she would literally have no place to go, ......and would be buried in an eternal oblivion.
PC Japanese (JP): それに甘んじたなら、……居場所は文字通り失われ、……永遠の忘却に葬り去られる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それに甘んじたなら、……居場所は文字通り失われ、……永遠の忘却に葬り去られる。
Russian (RU): Если она будет довольствоваться этим...... ей в прямом смысле будет некуда пойти...... и её погребут в вечном забвении.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se ela resignasse àquilo, ......ela literalmente não teria para onde ir, ......e seria enterrada no esquecimento eterno.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果甘心於此，……那就會如字面意思般失去立足之地，……自己將葬身於永遠的忘卻中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果甘心于此，……那就会如字面意思般失去立足之地，……自己将葬身于永远的忘却中。

Umineko Project (UP): Erika endured with a hideous expression, looking with shame at the back of the master who was ignoring her.
Steam (ST): Erika endured this with a hideous expression, looking with shame at the back of the master who ignored her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Erika endured with a hideous expression, looking with shame at the back of the master who was ignoring her.
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカは、自分を無視する主の背中の屈辱に、醜い笑顔を浮かべながら耐える。
Russian (RU): Эрика с отвращением терпела, со стыдом смотря в спину госпоже, игнорирующей её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Erika suportou com uma hedionda expressão em sua face, olhando com pena as costas da mentora que a ignorava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花浮現出了醜惡的笑容，強忍著主人背對自己、無視自己的屈辱。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花浮现出了丑恶的笑容，强忍着主人背对自己、无视自己的屈辱。

Umineko Project (UP): And with both fists clenched, she thought frantically for some kind of breakthrough.
Steam (ST): And with both fists clenched, she thought frantically in search of some kind of breakthrough.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And with both fists clenched, she thought frantically for some kind of breakthrough.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、何かの手柄が得られないか、両拳を握り締め、ぐるぐると思考した。
Russian (RU): И, сжав кулаки, она отчаянно думала, как прорваться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E com ambos os punhos cerrados, ela pensou freneticamente em alguma forma de derrotar o vermelho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，她為能否設法立功表現，握緊雙拳，轉動腦筋努力思考。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，她为能否设法立功表现，握紧双拳，转动脑筋努力思考。

Umineko Project (UP): I am the detective, I am Furudo Erika.{n}I am the piece and double and servant of the great Lady {f:5:Bernkastel}...!!
Steam (ST): I am the detective, I am Furudo Erika. I am the piece and double and servant of the Great Lady {f:5:Bernkastel}...!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I am the detective, I am Furudo Erika. I am the piece and double and servant of the great Lady Bernkastel...!!
PC Japanese (JP): 我こそは探偵、我こそは古戸ヱリカ。大ベルンカステル卿の駒にして分身にして使者…！！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 我こそは探偵、我こそは古戸ヱリカ。{n}大ベルンカステル卿の駒にして分身にして使者…！！
Russian (RU): Я — детектив, Фурудо Эрика.{n}Фигура, двойник и слуга великой леди {f:5:Бернкастель}!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu sou a detetive, eu sou Furudo Erika.{n}Sou a peça, e também dublê e servente da Grande Lady {f:5:Bernkastel}...!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我是偵探，我是古戶繪梨花。{n}是大貝倫卡斯泰露卿的棋子、分身、使者…！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我是侦探，我是古户绘梨花。{n}是大贝伦卡斯泰露卿的棋子、分身、使者…！！

Umineko Project (UP): I'll definitely make her satisfied...satisfied...definitely, definitely, gah, ggghggghhhhhh, ......Ushiromiya Battler......how dare you......humiliate me so............
Steam (ST): I'll definitely make her satisfied... satisfied... definitely, definitely, gah, ggghggghhhhhh, ...Ushiromiya Battler... ...how dare you... ...humiliate me so.........
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'll definitely make her satisfied... satisfied... definitely, definitely, gah, ggghggghhhhhh, ......Ushiromiya Battler......how dare you......humiliate me so............
PC Japanese (JP): 必ずや主にご満足を、ご満足を、絶対絶対、く、ぐぐぐぐぐぐぐ、……右代宮戦人め、……よくも、……この私に、恥を…ぉ…………ッ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 必ずや主にご満足を、ご満足を、絶対絶対、く、ぐぐぐぐぐぐぐ、……右代宮戦人め、……よくも、……この私に、恥を…ぉ…………ッ。
Russian (RU): Я обязательно оправдаю её ожидания...... оправдаю... обязательно, обязательно, гха, гх‐х‐х‐х...... Уширомия Баттлер...... как ты посмел... так меня унизить.........
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu definitivamente a deixarei satisfeita...satisfeita...definitivamente, definitivamente, gah, ggghggghhhhhh, ......Ushiromiya Battler......como ousa......me humilhar assim............
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 必要令我主滿意，令我主滿意，絕對絕對，咕、咕咕咕咕咕咕咕，……死右代宮戰人，……竟敢令，……我，蒙…羞…………。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 必要令我主满意，令我主满意，绝对绝对，咕、咕咕咕咕咕咕咕，……死右代宫战人，……竟敢令，……我，蒙…羞…………。

Umineko Project (UP): As she stood there, ignored by the witches and shrouded in darkness, it looked like she had been made to go stand on her own in the hallway...
Steam (ST): As she stood there, ignored by the witches and shrouded in darkness, it looked like someone had told her to go stand all alone in the hallway...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As she stood there, ignored by the witches and shrouded in darkness, it looked like someone had told her to go stand all alone in the hallway...
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女たちに無視され、暗闇で立ち尽くすヱリカの姿はまるで、廊下か何かにひとりぼっちで立たされているかのように見えた…。
Russian (RU): Она стояла во мраке, игнорируемая ведьмами, словно её выставили в коридор...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto permanecia lá, sendo ignorada pelas bruxas, envolta pela escuridão, pareceu como se ela tivesse ido, por conta própria, para o corredor ficar para lá...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 被魔女們無視，佇立於黑暗中的繪梨花的身影，看起來簡直就像是獨自在走廊或別處被罰站一般…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 被魔女们无视，伫立于黑暗中的绘梨花的身影，看起来简直就像是独自在走廊或别处被罚站一般…。

Umineko Project (UP): With the crime in the early morning, we'd completely forgotten about breakfast, so we now had our first meal of the day at a time that could never be called breakfast time...
Steam (ST): With the crime in the early morning, we'd completely forgotten about breakfast, so we now had our first meal of the day at a time that could never be called breakfast time...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With the crime in the early morning, we'd completely forgotten about breakfast, so we now had our first meal of the day at a time that could never be called breakfast time...
PC Japanese (JP): 朝からとんでもない事件が起こり、朝食を忘れていた俺たちは、もはや、朝食とは呼べない時間に、今日最初の食事をもくもくと取っていた…。
Russian (RU): Из‐за преступления ранним утром мы совершенно забыли о завтраке, и сейчас было время нашего первого приёма пищи за день, но его никак нельзя было назвать завтраком...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com o crime que ocorreu logo no início da manhã, nós esquecemos completamente sobre o café da manhã, e agora estamos tendo nossa primeira refeição do dia que sequer pode ser chamada de café da manhã...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一大早就發生了駭人的事件，把早飯都給忘了的我們，在已晚到無法稱為早飯的此刻，一聲不響地吃著今天頭一頓飯…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一大早就发生了骇人的事件，把早饭都给忘了的我们，在已晚到无法称为早饭的此刻，一声不响地吃着今天头一顿饭…。

Umineko Project (UP): Even Gohda‐san's wonderful meal, which had supposedly been in the works since yesterday night, provided no comfort.
Steam (ST): Even Gohda-san's wonderful meal, which had supposedly been in the works since yesterday, provided no comfort.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even Gohda-san's wonderful meal, which had supposedly been in the works since yesterday, provided no comfort.
PC Japanese (JP): 昨夜から仕込んでいたという、郷田さんの素晴らしき朝食も、まったく心を慰めてはくれない。
Russian (RU): Даже превосходный обед Годы, который вроде как со вчерашнего дня был весь в работе, не приносил комфорта.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nem mesmo a maravilhosa comida do Gohda‐san, a qual ele supostamente esteve trabalhando desde a noite passada, foi capaz de nos providenciar algum conforto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 據說從昨晚起就在醞釀的，鄉田烹制的上佳早餐，也完全無法撫慰我們的心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 据说从昨晚起就在酝酿的，乡田烹制的上佳早餐，也完全无法抚慰我们的心。

Umineko Project (UP): The several empty seats quietly burdened us with a pain‐filled sadness......
Steam (ST): The several empty seats quietly burdened us with a pain-filled sadness...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The several empty seats quietly burdened us with a pain-filled sadness......
PC Japanese (JP): ぽっかりと空いた数人の空席が、痛みを伴う悲しみを、静かに強いるのだった……。
Russian (RU): Несколько пустых мест тихо обременяли нас мучительной печалью......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os vários assentos vazios silenciosamente forçavam em nós uma forte dor recheada de tristeza......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 突兀空出的數人的空席，靜靜地將伴有痛楚的悲傷，強加於人……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 突兀空出的数人的空席，静静地将伴有痛楚的悲伤，强加于人……。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, in the middle of this meal that felt like a vigil, Erika suddenly stood up.
Steam (ST): Then, in the middle of this meal that felt like a vigil, Erika suddenly stood up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, in the middle of this meal that felt like a vigil, Erika suddenly stood up.
PC Japanese (JP): するとそんなお通夜のような食事の最中に突然、ヱリカが、がばっと立ち上がる。
Russian (RU): В разгар этой трапезы, похожей на бессменное бдение, Эрика неожиданно встала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, no meio da refeição que parecia uma vigília, Erika apareceu de repente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這恰似靈前守夜的會餐中，繪梨花突然猛地站起身來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这恰似灵前守夜的会餐中，绘梨花突然猛地站起身来。

Umineko Project (UP): Everyone focused on her to see what was the matter.
Steam (ST): Everyone focused on her to see what was the matter.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Everyone focused on her to see what was the matter.
PC Japanese (JP): 何事かと一同が注目する。
Russian (RU): Все сосредоточились на ней, смотря, в чём дело.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos prestaram atenção nela para entender o que estava acontecendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 心想“怎麼了”，眾人一同望向了她。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 心想“怎么了”，众人一同望向了她。

Umineko Project (UP): Her expression was somewhere on the line between invigorated and insane, as though she'd come up with some groundbreaking and strange invention.
Steam (ST): Her expression was somewhere between relief and insanity, as though she'd made some groundbreaking and strange discovery.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Her expression was somewhere on the line between relieved and insane, as though she'd made some groundbreaking and strange discovery.
PC Japanese (JP): まるで、画期的かつ異常な発明を思いついたかのような、清々しさと狂気が紙一重の形相だった。
Russian (RU): Её выражение было на грани между облегчением и безумием, как будто она сделала инновационное и странное открытие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sua expressão estava entre a linha do revigorado e a insanidade, como se tivesse trazido consigo uma estranha e inovadora invenção.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 其表情簡直像是想到了劃時代的變態發明一般，難以分清是欣喜暢快還是興奮癲狂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 其表情简直像是想到了划时代的变态发明一般，难以分清是欣喜畅快还是兴奋癫狂。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "......Hey, what's up? Are you okay...?"
Steam (ST): "...Hey, what's up? Are you okay...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……おい、どうした。大丈夫か…？」
Russian (RU): "......Эй, что такое? Ты в порядке?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Ei, o que foi? Você está bem...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……喂，怎麼了？沒事吧…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……喂，怎么了？没事吧…？」

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "I've got it, I've got it!! Did you think I wouldn't be able to work it out? Oh, I understand perfectly well, there's no way something so stupid could happen...!"
Steam (ST): "I've got it, I've got it!! Did you think I wouldn't understand? Yes, I've got it, there's no way something that stupid could happen...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I've got it, I've got it!! Did you think I wouldn't understand? Yes, I've got it, there's no way something that stupid could happen...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「わかりました、わかりましたッ！！　私にわからないとお思いですか？　えぇ、わかりますとも、そんな馬鹿なこと、あるわけがない…！」
Russian (RU): "Я поняла, поняла! Думали, не пойму? Да, я знаю, такая нелепость просто невозможна!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu entendi, eu entendi!! Achou que eu não seria capaz de descobrir? Ora, pois eu entendi perfeitamente, não tem como algo tão estúpido ter acontecido...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「明白了，明白了！！還以為我搞不懂？是啊，當然搞得懂，這種蠢事，是不可能發生的…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「明白了，明白了！！还以为我搞不懂？是啊，当然搞得懂，这种蠢事，是不可能发生的…！」

Umineko Project (UP): With an ugly expression covered with cold sweat, Erika glared and lashed out at Battler.
Steam (ST): With a hideous expression covered in cold sweat, Erika glared and lashed out at Battler.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com uma expressão disforme e coberta de suor frio, Erika encarou e açoitou Battler.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花以一張浮著冷汗的激動面孔瞪著戰人，邊說邊指指點點。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花以一张浮着冷汗的激动面孔瞪着战人，边说边指指点点。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………明白了？……明白什麼了……？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………明白了？……明白什么了……？」

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "There's no way you jumped down from the third‐floor study...! Not one of us saw you fall down and land in the courtyard...!!"
Steam (ST): "There's no way you jumped down from the third floor study...! Not one of us saw you fall down and land in the courtyard...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "There's no way you jumped down from the third floor study...! Not one of us saw you fall down and land in the courtyard...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「あなたが、３階の書斎から飛び降りられるわけなんか、ないじゃないですか…！　私たちは誰一人、あんたが飛び降り、中庭に着地したところなんて見てないんですから…！！」
Russian (RU): "Вы не {i:могли спрыгнуть} с третьего этажа!.. Никто из нас не видел, как вы приземлились во дворе!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não tem como você ter pulado do terceiro andar do estúdio...! Nenhum de nós viu você caindo e pousando no pátio...!!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你不可能是从 3 楼书房跳楼平安着陆的…！因为，我们中没有一个人看到你跳下去，于里院着地时的情景…！！」

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "{p:2:When you set up the ladder from the courtyard and saw Rudolf‐san go up it to the third‐story window, you closely observed the structure of the outer wall and realized that by cleverly using the rain gutters and other handholds, it would be possible to descend to the courtyard from the third‐floor window...! You didn't {i:jump down}! You used the rain gutters and so on and clambered down the outer wall like a loser}!! What do you think of my blue truth?!! Come on, where's your rebuttal?!"
Steam (ST): "{p:2:When you set up the ladder from the courtyard and saw Rudolf‐san go up it to the third‐story window, you closely observed the structure of the outer wall and realized that by cleverly using the rain gutters and other handholds, it would be possible to descend to the courtyard from the third‐floor window...! You didn't {i:jump down}! You used the rain gutters and so on and clambered down the outer wall like a loser}!! What do you think of my blue truth?!! Come on, what's your counterargument?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "{p:2:When you set up the ladder from the courtyard and saw Rudolf-san go up it to the third story window, you closely observed the construction of the outer wall, and realized that by cleverly using a rain gutter, it might be possible to go down to the courtyard from the third floor window...! You didn't jump down! You used a rain gutter or something and clumsily wriggled down the outer wall!! What do you think of my blue truth?!! Come on, what's your counterargument?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「{p:2:あなたは中庭からハシゴを掛けて、３階の窓に留弗夫さんが上るのを見ていた時。その外壁の構造をよく観察し、雨どいなどをうまく伝えば、３階の窓から中庭に下りることは不可能じゃないと気付いたんです…！　あなたは飛び降りてなんかいない！　雨どいなどを伝い、みっともなく外壁を這い下りたんですッ！！}どうです、私の青き真実は！！　さぁ、反論は？！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「{p:2:あなたは中庭からハシゴを掛けて、３階の窓に留弗夫さんが上るのを見ていた時。その外壁の構造をよく観察し、雨どいなどをうまく伝えば、３階の窓から中庭に下りることは不可能じゃないと気付いたんです…！　あなたは飛び降りてなんかいない！　雨どいなどを伝い、みっともなく外壁を這い下りたんですッ！！}　どうです、私の青き真実は！！　さぁ、反論は？！」
Russian (RU): "{p:2:Поставив лестницу во дворе и увидев, как Рудольф поднимается к окну третьего этажа, вы рассмотрели вблизи конструкцию внешней стены и поняли, что можно спуститься во внутренний двор из окна третьего этажа по водостоку!.. Вы не прыгали! {p:2:Вы неуклюже спускались по водостоку наружной стены}!!! Как вам моя голубая правда?!! Каким будет ваш контраргумент}?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "{p:2:Quando você levou a escada para o pátio e viu o Rudolf‐san subindo nela até o terceiro andar, você observou atentamente a estrutura da parede externa e percebeu astutamente que, usando as calhas e outros pontos de apoio, seria possível descer até o pátio estando no terceiro andar...! Você não {i:pulou}! Você usou as calhas e foi trepando pela parede externa para descer igual um perdedor}!! O que acha da minha verdade azul?! Vamos, cadê sua réplica?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「{p:2:你在里院搭好梯子，看著留弗夫先生爬向 3 樓窗戶的時候。仔細觀察了外壁的構造，注意到了只要攀著雨水管什麼的，從 3 樓的窗戶爬到里院就並非不可能…！你才沒有跳樓呢！你是攀著雨水管什麼的，遜斃了地沿外牆爬下去的！！}如何呀，我的藍色真實？！！來啊，你的反駁呢？！」

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, as the sound of wind and rain slowly filled the room once again, ......Erika slowly opened her eyes as though recovering from a bout of dizziness.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、ゆっくりと元通りの風雨の音が部屋を満たすと、……まるで立ち眩みから目覚めたように、ヱリカはうっすらと目を開ける。
Russian (RU): Затем, когда комнату снова начал окутывать шум ветра и дождя...... она медленно открыла глаза, словно оправившись от приступа головокружения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, o som do vento e da chuva gradualmente preencheram o quarto mais uma vez, ......Erika lentamente abriu seus olhos como se tivesse se recuperado de uma tontura.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，在風雨之聲慢慢照原樣地充滿房間後，……簡直就像從眩暈中清醒過來似的，繪梨花微微睜開了雙目。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，在风雨之声慢慢照原样地充满房间后，……简直就像从眩晕中清醒过来似的，绘梨花微微睁开了双目。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, she continued eating in silence as though nothing had happened.
Steam (ST): Then, she continued eating in silence as though nothing had happened.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, she continued eating in silence as though nothing had happened.
PC Japanese (JP): すると、何事もなかったかのように、静かに食事を再開する。
Russian (RU): А потом продолжила молча есть как ни в чём не бывало.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E assim, ela continuou a comer em silêncio como se nada tivesse acontecido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，她如什麼事都沒發生般，靜靜地重新吃起了飯。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，她如什么事都没发生般，静静地重新吃起了饭。

Umineko Project (UP): As if she had been acting normally the whole time.
Steam (ST): As if she had been acting normally the whole time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As if she had been acting normally the whole time.
PC Japanese (JP): 先ほどからずっとそうであるかのように、平然と。
Russian (RU): Как будто всё это время вела себя нормально.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como se estivesse agindo normalmente o tempo todo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就如從剛才起一直都是這樣似的，平靜自若。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就如从刚才起一直都是这样似的，平静自若。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Didn't Erika just stand up suddenly and rant at someone......?
Steam (ST): ...Didn't Erika just stand up suddenly and yell something strange at someone...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Didn't Erika just stand up suddenly and yell something strange at someone......?
PC Japanese (JP): ……今、ヱリカは突然立ち上がって、おかしなことを捲くし立てなかったっけ……？
Russian (RU): ......Разве не Эрика только что неожиданно встала и прокричала кому‐то нечто странное?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Erika não tinha acabado de aparecer e resmungar com alguém......?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……剛才，繪梨花會不會其實並未突然站起來，指指點點地講些莫名其妙的話……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……刚才，绘梨花会不会其实并未突然站起来，指指点点地讲些莫名其妙的话……？

Umineko Project (UP): Erika continued eating quietly, her behavior so perfectly normal that everyone started to doubt themselves.
Steam (ST): Automatically, enough to make one doubt their eyes, Erika continued eating quietly as though everything was perfectly normal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Automatically, enough to make one doubt their eyes, Erika continued eating quietly as though everything was perfectly normal.
PC Japanese (JP): 思わず、自問したくなるくらいに、ヱリカはさも当然のように、静かに食事を続けている。
Russian (RU): Эрика продолжала молча есть, и её самое обыкновенное поведение заставило всех сомневаться в ранее увиденном.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Erika continuou a comer em silêncio, seus modos eram tão normais que todos começaram a duvidar deles mesmos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花神色舉動自然到了，以致於令人不禁如此自問地，靜靜地吃著飯。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花神色举动自然到了，以致于令人不禁如此自问地，静静地吃着饭。

Umineko Project (UP): After seeing her behaving so calmly, ......everyone convinced themselves that they were totally worn out, and that they must have just hallucinated Erika suddenly yelling.
Steam (ST): When they saw how ordinary she looked, ...everyone convinced themselves that they were totally worn out... and that they must have just seen some illusion of Erika suddenly yelling.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When they saw this ordinary appearance ......everyone convinced themselves that they were totally worn out and that they must have just seen some illusion of Erika suddenly yelling.
PC Japanese (JP): その平然とした様子に一同は、……自分たちが疲れてしまっていて、ヱリカが突然叫び出すような幻を見てしまったんだろうと、それぞれが自分を納得させてしまった。
Russian (RU): По её невозмутимому виду...... все пришли к выводу, что окончательно вымотались, и что им просто померещилось, как Эрика вдруг закричала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após vê‐la tão calma, ......todos se convenceram que estavam completamente exaustos, e devem ter tido uma alucinação onde Erika começou a gritar de repente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 面對她這副若無其事的樣子，……眾人紛紛以“大概是自己累了，所以才看到了繪梨花突然喊叫起來的幻覺”為由，說服了自己。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 面对她这副若无其事的样子，……众人纷纷以“大概是自己累了，所以才看到了绘梨花突然喊叫起来的幻觉”为由，说服了自己。

Umineko Project (UP): So Erika's sudden transfiguration of a few seconds ago was treated as a daydream, and faded out of everyone's memory......
Steam (ST): So Erika's sudden transfiguration of a few seconds ago was treated as a daydream... and faded out of everyone's memories...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So Erika's sudden transfiguration of a few seconds ago was treated as a daydream and faded out of everyone's memories......
PC Japanese (JP): だから、ほんの数瞬前のヱリカの変貌ぶりは、白昼夢のような扱いとなり、すぐに全員の記憶から薄れていった……。
Russian (RU): Её внезапное изменение несколько секунд назад посчитали видением, и оно исчезло из их памяти......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim a transfiguração repentina de Erika de segundos atrás foi tratada como um devaneio, desaparecendo das memórias de todos......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，區區數秒前的繪梨花的異樣表現，被大家當成了白日夢，立刻就在所有人的記憶中漸漸淡去……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，区区数秒前的绘梨花的异样表现，被大家当成了白日梦，立刻就在所有人的记忆中渐渐淡去……。

Umineko Project (UP): Erika quietly poked at her salad and muttered in a voice no one could hear.
Steam (ST): Erika quietly poked at her salad and muttered in a voice no one could hear.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Erika quietly poked at her salad and muttered in a voice no one could hear.
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカは、静かにサラダを突きながら、誰にも聞こえぬ声で呟く。
Russian (RU): Эрика, спокойно тыкающая вилкой в салат, пробормотала так, что никто не слышал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Erika silenciosamente cutucou sua salada e murmurou com uma voz na qual ninguém foi capaz de ouvir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花靜靜地戳著沙拉，以誰都聽不到的小聲，嘟噥道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花静静地戳着沙拉，以谁都听不到的小声，嘟哝道。

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): Thank you very much, Great Lady {f:5:Bernkastel}...... I am Furudo Erika. I am my master's piece and her double. ......I will most certainly present you with an incredible tale. Eheheh{0}eheh......
Steam (ST): Thank you very much, Great Lady {f:5:Bernkastel}... I am Furudo Erika. I am my master's piece and her double. ...I will most certainly present you with an incredible tale. Heheheheh...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Thank you very much, great Lady Bernkastel...... I am Furudo Erika. I am my master's piece and her double. ......I will most certainly present you with an incredible tale. Eheheheheh......
PC Japanese (JP): ありがとうございます、大ベルンカステル卿……。我こそは古戸ヱリカ。我が主の駒にして分身。……必ずや、あなたのために最高の物語を献上してご覧にいれます。うっふふふふ……。
Russian (RU): Благодарю вас, великая леди {f:5:Бернкастель}... Я — Фурудо Эрика. Фигура и двойник госпожи. ......Я непременно подарю вам невероятную историю. Эхе‐хе‐хе‐хех......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Muito obrigada, Grande Lady {f:5:Bernkastel}...... Eu sou Furudo Erika. Eu sou a peça e dublê de minha mentora. ......Eu certamente irei apresentar a você um conto incrível. Eheheh{0}eheh......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 非常感謝，大貝倫卡斯泰露卿……。我是古戶繪梨花。是我主的棋子兼分身。……我必將為您，獻上最棒的故事給您看。嗚、哼哼哼哼哼……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 非常感谢，大贝伦卡斯泰露卿……。我是古户绘梨花。是我主的棋子兼分身。……我必将为您，献上最棒的故事给您看。呜、哼哼哼哼哼……。

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "Oh, yes, knives and forks are such primitive utensils, aren't they? Chopsticks are best. They're the easiest way to eat a salad, don't you agree? Well, everyone?"
Steam (ST): "That's right, when it comes to utensils, knives and forks are pretty primitive. Chopsticks are the best. Don't you think chopsticks are the easiest way to eat salad? Well, everyone?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That's right, when it comes to utensils, knives and forks are pretty primitive. Chopsticks are the best. Don't you think chopsticks are the easiest way to eat salad? Well, everyone?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうそう、やっぱりナイフとフォークって、食器として原始的ですよね。お箸が一番です。サラダをもっとも食べやすいのはお箸だとは思いませんか？　ねぇ、皆さん？」
Russian (RU): "Точно, точно, что касается столовых приборов, ножи и вилки весьма примитивны. Палочки лучше. Не кажется ли вам, что ими есть салат проще всего? А, дамы и господа?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ah, sim, facas e garfos são utensílios tão primitivos, não concordam? Hashis são superiores. Com eles é muito mais fácil comer uma salada, não concordam? Não é mesmo, pessoal?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「對了，果然刀叉作為餐具，是有點原始呢。還是筷子最棒。不覺得，筷子才最便於享用沙拉麼？是吧，諸位？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「对了，果然刀叉作为餐具，是有点原始呢。还是筷子最棒。不觉得，筷子才最便于享用沙拉么？是吧，诸位？」
